briefdescription.para: Magic number at the start of a tzfile (TZif).
Port for selecting CMOS register index.
Port for reading/writing CMOS register data.
CMOS I/O port addresses for RTC register access.
POSIX-style time representation.

detaileddescription.para: Number of seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970 (the epoch). This implementation uses a signed 64-bit type to allow for historical and far-future date handling beyond the 2038 limit.

briefdescription.para: File magic: "TZif".
Reserved/padding.
Count of UTC/local indicators.
Count of standard/wall indicators.
Number of leap-second corrections.
Number of transition times.
Number of local time types.
Size of abbreviation string table.
ACPI Root System Description Pointer (RSDP)

detaileddescription.para: Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Convert a time_t timestamp to a datetime_t (UTC).

parameterdescription.para: Output pointer for the decomposed date/time.

briefdescription.para: Get the UTC offset/DST state for a given time from a loaded tzfile buffer.

simplesect.para: Offset from UTC in seconds (including DST if applicable).

briefdescription.para: Convert a UTC time_t to local time using the loaded timezone.

simplesect.para: Local time as seconds since epoch.

briefdescription.para: Load and parse a timezone file from the system tzdb.

simplesect.para: True if successfully loaded, false if not found or invalid.

briefdescription.para: Get the current date/time as a formatted string.

detaileddescription.para: The returned string uses the format: "Mon, 28 Jul 2025 01:45:12".

simplesect.para: Pointer to a static buffer (overwritten on each call).

briefdescription.para: Read the current RTC value into a datetime_t.
Initialise the Real-Time Clock (RTC) subsystem.

detaileddescription.para: Configures RTC access and disables periodic interrupts. Must be called during early kernel initialisation.

briefdescription.para: Get the current system time in seconds since epoch.

parameterdescription.para: Optional pointer to store the result.

briefdescription.para: Calculate day-of-year (1–366) for a given date.
Get the weekday index for a given date.
Interfaces for accessing, converting, and formatting real-time clock (RTC) and timezone values.

detaileddescription.para:
Craig Edwards (craigedwards@brainbox.cc)
Copyright (c) 2012–2025
This header defines types and functions for:
Reading the hardware Real-Time Clock (RTC) via CMOS I/O ports
Representing dates/times as POSIX time_t values and datetime_t components
Loading and interpreting IANA tzdb time zone files (TZif format)
Converting between UTC and local time with DST adjustments
Generating formatted date/time strings for display
